abstract: It’s not exactly written in stone, but Southfork Kitchen is slated to open on … soon.
snippet: It’s not exactly written in stone, but Southfork Kitchen is slated to open on … soon.
lead_paragraph: Here’s the plan, in one longish, timorous breath: the plan is to open the restaurant, and while nothing is written in stone or on stone crabs or any place else other than in our collective consciousness and on the blackboard above the bar, the plan is to open the restaurant called Southfork Kitchen on Sunday, Sept. 26, 2010 — please do not read any religious meaning into opening on a Sabbath — fully realizing that brand new restaurants are functioning, zoetic organisms, like stone crabs, forced to respond to a sea of shifting imperatives, which is why the plan is subject to change, and change, in this instance, means the date may be moved, this way or that, slightly.
